===Serial killers===
===Serial killers===
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including [[Richard Chase]], [[Ed Gein]], [[Winston Moseley]], [[Dennis Nilsen]], [[John Reginald Halliday Christie]], [[Bruno LÃ¼dke]], [[Jerry Brudos]], [[Gary Ridgway]], [[Ted Bundy]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them (although Dahmer had only confessed to eating the bicep of a male); the technical term for this particular variant activity is [[cannibalism|necrophagia]]. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill [[Jerry Lynn Dean]]. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including [[Richard Chase]], [[Ed Gein]], [[Winston Moseley]], [[Dennis Nilsen]], [[John Reginald Halliday Christie]], [[Bruno LÃ¼dke]], [[Jerry Brudos]], [[Gary Ridgway]], [[Ted Bundy]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them (although Dahmer had only confessed to eating the bicep of a male); the technical term for this particular variant activity is [[cannibalism|necrophagia]]. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill [[Jerry Lynn Dean]]. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.

===Attempted Necrophilia===
  â
{{main|Laura Tennessen}}
  â
On [[September 15]], [[2006]] a judge dismissed charges of attempted sexual assault against three men accused of trying to dig up a woman's body to have sex with the corpse, noting that Wisconsin has no law against necrophilia. Twins [[Nicholas Grunke|Nicholas]] and [[Alexander Grunke]], 20, and [[Dustin Radke]], 20, were arrested after an alleged attempt to dig up the body of 20-year-old [[Laura Tennessen]] who was killed Aug. 27 in a motorcycle crash. Officials said a caller reported suspicious activity in the cemetery Sept. 2, and deputies found someone had dug down to her vault. Radke told police that the three had stopped at a [[Wal-Mart]] on the way to the cemetery to buy condoms. Authorities said the three were not acquainted with Tennessen but had seen an obituary with her photo.
